https://nicolas-hoizey.photo/photos/reco.title: Reconstructed north entrance of the Palace of Minos in Knossos
https://nicolas-hoizey.photo/photos/reco.content_text:
“Reconstructed north entrance of the Palace of Minos in Knossos”

Knossos is a Bronze Age archaeological site in Crete.

It was a major centre of the Minoan civilization and is known for its association with the Greek myth of Theseus and the minotaur.

Knossos is considered by many to be the oldest city in Europe.

“Scarlet ibis”

The Scarlet ibis resembles most of the other species of ibis, but its remarkably brilliant scarlet coloration makes it unmistakable.

https://nicolas-hoizey.photo/photos/who-.content_text:
“Who is the observer?”

The Masai giraffe is the largest subspecies of giraffe, making it the tallest land animal on earth.

It is native to East Africa. The Masai giraffe can be found in central and southern Kenya and in Tanzania.

https://nicolas-hoizey.photo/photos/la-m.title: La mère rouge
https://nicolas-hoizey.photo/photos/la-m.content_text:
“La mère rouge”

This photo title is a play on words in French, where « mère » (“mother”) and « mer » (“sea”) are homophones.

Here, it is the mother (of our children) dressed in red, who is on a boat on the Red Sea, which is blue… 😅

🔎 https://nicolas-hoizey.photo/photos/la-mere-rouge/
